page.title: 09St.Johns Church Wetley Rocks
page.content: The church was built in 1834 and has always played a very large part in community life. It is very well attended by all ages and has close links with St.John's Primary School. During the year there are many important services including the Palm Sunday Cross Bearing service. Three crosses are carried from Withy Stakes through the avenues into Wetley Rocks. The crosses are then erected upon the rocks and an open air service is conducted below. Christmas Eve mass is also a popular service as is the Harvest Festival where gifts are brought into church and later distributed to the elderly. The church also holds functions such as the summer garden party at the Black & White House in Consall and the Christmas Bazaar which enhances the close links with the community.
